content.description: Starts under large pyramid shaped feature, press onto the slab then move into underclings to give you the room to stand up, make one big reach up to a jug at the top of the pyramid, hike your feet up and scurry through easy terrain to the top of the boulder.
content.location: On the Pyramid Boulder, left of the Downclimb Slab and right of the Pyramid Slab.

content.description: When walking up to the boulder, the slab is on the left side (right of the Pyramid Face).  Can be climbed several different ways using pockets and side pulls, all pretty fun.  All sides of this boulder can be climbed, eliminating some holds can make for harder problems.
Climb the tallest steepest face (the backside) of the boulder.  Middle line is probably the best, but the face can be climbed with several different lines.
Very easy slab up the middle of the back side of the Pyramid boulder. Stand start in the middle of the low angle slab and wander your way up to the top. Try it no hands for a challenge.
content.location: Back side of the Pyramid boulder, the side you approach if coming to it from the Blank boulder (closest to the trail from the parking lot).

content.description: Stand start on the right arete of the downclimb slab, walk up the slab using great holds on the arete, topout same as the downclimb.
content.location: Back side of the Pyramid boulder, the side you approach when coming in from the Blank boulder.

content.description: A pyramid shaped boulder with a bunch of fun easy slab problems.
